description: {"blocks":[{"key":"rept","text":"The protocol describes steps for electroporation transformation of Ostreococcus taurii. This protocol is a direct version of published transformation protocol, https://dx.doi.org/10.3791/4074 by van Ooijen et al. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":67,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":31}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CD2F412985DD11EC99D00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.3791/4074"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"67cgo","text":"Culture Ostreococcus taurii cells in K-media. The protocol used to prepare K-media is ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":8,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3la3r","text":"dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.brv7m69n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"95ppd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6k0fk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86uds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"870DE17085E111EC99D00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.brv7m69n"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4thoh","text":"Sub-culture Ostreococcus taurii cells in K-media at 1% dilution every 10 days and grow in a plant growth chamber under constant light and a Lee Moonlight Blue filter 183 (http://www.leefilters.com/lighting/colour-details.html#183\u0026filter=cf). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":171,"length":68}],"data":{}},{"key":"21gfp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6uudu","text":"Keep light intensity at 20 μmol m-2 s-1 and temperature at   . Shake the every 1 to 3 days to reduce aggregation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":59,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3hbug","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9411779385D811EC99D00A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://www.leefilters.com/lighting/colour-details.html#183\u0026filter=cf"}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"546A483085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"23","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fje2f","text":"Collect 50mL cells for each transformation at a a cell density of 20-30 x 10^6 mL-1, about 7 days after subculturing. Count approximate cell density using a haemocytometer at 40x magnification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77cif","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2vph","text":"Prepare DNA by using the Qiagen midi prep kit to obtain   of pure plasmid DNA in a concentration of   in sterile deionized water. Digest product with an appropriate single cutter restriction enzyme to linearize the plasmid. Purify through ethanol precipitation or PCR purification kit.  Re-suspend or elute the linearized plasmid in appropriate amount of sterile deionized water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7dflq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dadv0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7niu6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"D44B193085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"DA353A6085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":205}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d78f9","text":"For midi-prep, it is best to start inoculating the bacterial culture containing the desired plasmid two days before electroporation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5nssr","text":"Prepare microcentrifuge tubes containing   linearized plasmid DNA for each transformation. A control with no DNA is necessary for transformation. Keep these tubes on ice, together with a 2 mm electroporation cuvette for each transformation. The plasmid volume should not exceed   of the transformation mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":278,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8kc8b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"E95B8DF085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"EEB974B085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fr7rj","text":"Prepare   solution of Sorbitol in ddH2O and add   pluronic acid F68. Filter sterilize this solution. Prepare 2.2 ml of resuspension buffer for each transformation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1s19l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F6D40A7085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F306128085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

Pipette up and down to re-suspend the cells in   solution of resuspension buffer and transfer to a microcentrifuge tube. Centrifuge the tube for   at  . Repeat this wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":93,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":98,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":105,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":160,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":258,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":263,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bd9s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"FAEA07E085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"FE0BBA4085E111ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"8000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0394F6C085E211ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"10","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"0EAF861085E211ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"12073C9085E211ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"5":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"15C15E6085E211ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"6":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"8000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1B1A150085E211ECBDB599914F45D3AF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"10","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"50iok","text":"Resuspend each final pellet in   of resuspension buffer. After resuspension, add   of cells to each tube of linearized DNA. {"blocks":[{"key":"a6aou","text":"Electroporate the cells using the following electroporation parameters,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35a82","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqan2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"64iqa","text":"Voltage: 6 kV cm-1 (since we are using 2 mm cuvette, the voltage setting would be 1200 V)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9tn8","text":"Resistance: 600 Ω","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66pfs","text":"Capacitance: 25 μF","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"","data":{"id":1577,"brand":"Biorad","can_edit":0,"guid":"4E45246085E211ECBDB599914F45D3AF","link":"https://www.bio-rad.com/en-ca/sku/1652660-gene-pulser-xcell-total-system?ID=1652660","name":"Gene Pulser Xcell Electroporation Systems","sku":"1652660","specifications":null,"type":"Electroporator","vendor":{"id":272,"name":"BioRad Sciences","link":"http://www.bio-rad.com/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":{"id":69866,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/private/724e3eeddfd109fa5bf5a1bd6e3488d65941e11d17962d3e1f78efc6fab5026c/cehkh4ve.jpg","name":"165-2660_view.jpg","icon":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/jpg.png"}}}}}

Make sure not to disturb the cell globule. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eurip","text":"Take the cells from the growth chamber into a sterile flow hood. Add   of LMP agarose to each of the   tubes with   K-media, close and mix by inverting.
